dialogues.FATHER BENEDETTO:
[1]You are American. 
[2]You speak Italian? 
[3]Va bene! You stay at Pensione Arbruzzo. 
[4]On vacation?

[7]People? 
[8]Ah! Magazine! Which magazine? 
[9]Va bene. So you must share a glass of wine with me. Questa sera. This evening. 
[10]Certo. You want to know the truth about Abruzzo? A priest sees everything. 
[11]Que siamo! The quality of the brandy is good, the liquor is smooth and the glass warmed by the sun. 
[12]The only good thing to come from the Francesi, everything else... 
[13]The French are... pezzi di merda. This is not an American discovery. Italians have known this for centuries. [In ITALIAN] When Rome called France the province of Gaul, they were just the same. Arrogant sensualists. Their cuisine is fussy and their wine effeminate. Only their brandy is worthy of any attention. 
[14]Forgive me. I speak too fast. You study our history? 
[15]You come to Italy to make a guide book and you don't care about history? 
[16]Of course. You are American. You think you can escape history. You live for the present. 
[17]All the sheep in my flock are dear to me, but some are dearer than most. Especially those that have strayed from the fold. 
[18]Fabio. He is a... [in ITALIAN] 'car doctor'. But I suspect his practice is not entirely sound. Ecco! 
[19]Fagiano. Pheasant. With sauce of orange juice, orange peel, chestnuts, garlic, Marsala wine and... Come si dici in Inglese? Brodo di Pollo. Chicken broth. 
[20]Also: salsify in garlic butter. Mange-tout. Fried wild mushrooms with truffle. 
[21]The Holy Father eats better than this. 
[22]Have you ever wanted to be anything other than a... come se dice in Inglese...? 
[23]Photographer. 
[24]I'm sure you have other talents. You have the hands of a craftsman, not an artist. You are good with machines. Yet you told me just the opposite when we first met. 
[25]Journalism cannot make you a rich man. 
[26]Perhaps you are rich already? 
[27]My meagre income is subject to the vagaries of the stock market and with church attendance declining there's less and less money in the offertory. But if a man has God in his vaults... 
[28]I know better than to try to make a convert over pheasant and Trebbiano. 
[29]"The grave soul keeps its own secrets, and takes its own punishment in silence." 
[30]I've been looking for you. 
[31]A man was here asking questions about you. 
[32]He came to the church this afternoon. 
[33]To know where you live. He said he was a friend from Switzerland. 
[34]Of course I do not tell him. How do I know him? He is maybe the police. Certainly he is no friend. A friend would know your pensione. Besides... 
[35]Friends do not carry guns. 
[36]If you live in Italy, and you are a man of the cloth, you meet many people. Besides, I lived once in Naples. If you live in Naples you know the difference between a fat wallet and a... custodia per armi di spalla. How you say in English? 
[37]Si. 
[38]I am a priest. 
[39]Signor Clarke? 
[40]I make a mistake. He did not say he was from La Svizzera: Switzerland. He said- forgive me the names in Italian are so similar- La Svezia: Sweden. 
[41]Buon giorno! 
[42]I walk here to meditate. Once a week, Wednesday, the farthest one can travel in the week from the Sabbath. The trees are like the Stations of the Cross: by certain trees I thank God for certain favours he has granted me, or certain gifts he has made to me and all men. For example, here by this pine, I thank him for the many friendships I have and ask him to look after those of my friends who are troubled. 
[43]Some walk here in the cool of evening. Others come at night. 
[44]I wonder how many bastards have been made here? 
[45]Perhaps you'll stay and settle here yourself? 
[46]You told me as much when we first met. Besides, those who seek for peace seldom find it. They're always moving on, looking elsewhere. [A BEAT] And they are usually sinners. 
[47]Some are greater sinners than others. And those who seek peace have much sinning in their history. 
[48]Until now. 
[49]Forgive me. This is the priest in me speaking. And the friend. But you have done much sinning, Signor Clarke. You still do. 
[50]I do not refer to the sins of carnality. But to the deadly sins... 
[51]We are not discussing theology, my friend, but you. You like this town, this valley. 
[52]You should like to remain here and find your peace at last. Yet you cannot. There is something you cannot ignore. Some force. Some enemy. 
[53]You want to speak but you dare not. You know no one sufficiently well to share your history with them. You know I am trustworthy yet still you are cautious. 
[54]What job do you do, Signor? Are you on the run, as they say? 
[55]It's an expression, no? 
[56]Some men watch some of the shadows. You watch them all. 
[57]Do you wish to tell me? 
[58]For your own sake. Perhaps I can pray for you? 
[59]Counterfeit money? 
[60]You work in metal. You are given some steel by Fabio, the car doctor. 
[61]I know only what you do in the town. People talk to me. I am their priest and they trust me. 
[62]Of course. 
[63]Why do you ask me that? 
[64]I do not remember, Signor. It was twenty-five years ago. 
[65]In the end it is I who confesses to you. 
[66]Perhaps. For your own good. You cannot doubt the existence of Hell. You live in it. It is a place without love. As for me, I go about my daily duties because the town requires it of me. Some know what you know. Perhaps I have no right to wear these robes. But I do have a heart full of a father's love. Something close to His heart! And for that I am both grateful and happy. 
[67]What do you have, my friend? 
[68]Ciao Fabio, come stai? 
[69]Dear Father Benedetto. I promised myself that I would write to you- as your friend- to say goodbye... 
[70]Everything I've ever done... 
[71]I've done for a reason. 
[72]I will them that the man who wrote this letter is my friend. 
[73]Jack.
dialogues.LARRY:
[1]Jack. What brings you to Rome? 
[2]There's a bar across the street: the L'Aquila. Freshen up. Sit tight. Give me two hours. 
[3]You started smoking again? 
[4]Since when? 
[5]Due. 
[6]Stockholm account. Final installment. 
[7]You can't stay here, Jack. You won't see `em coming, not in a big city. But you can't go far, either. If the gentlemen whose accounts you closed belonged to Brink, Gallazzo, Simenov- any of the first division- you have four or five hours at most before every airport, train station, bus stop, toll booth and ski lift from Stockholm to Skopje is under surveillance. 
[8]So. You find a hole- somewhere nearby- and you crawl into it and you stay put until I say it's safe to come out. 
[9]Turn right outside the bar then second left. Via Spinetti. You'll find a silver Citroen C2 with Chieti plates. Check the glove box and follow the map. Castelvecchio. It's a fucking fortress. Literally. And as dead as a graveyard. Anyone within a three to five mile radius you'll see `em coming. 
[10]Get there. Stay there. 
[11]Do nothing `till you get my call. 
[12]Do you have any idea how long I've been trying to reach you? What happened to the cell I gave you? 
[13]Don't get jumpy on me, Jack. That cell was secure. 
[14]I've got a job. It's a custom fit. You don't even have to pull the trigger. 
[15]Relax. She triple checks out. Plus she comes to you. You don't have to move an inch. 
[16]So will anyone who's trying to kill you. 
[17]Think about this. I cleaned up your shit and made you disappear. You owe me my usual twenty percent commission plus the first installment. The rest is yours. After this you're free. 
[18]Clean bill of health and no OC. This was a straight favour with a dollar chaser, Jack. The guy's got a second cousin in NOCS on the graft who filched him the Socimi. 
[19]No one's gossiping, Jack. 
[20]Jack? 
[21]You got a long list of enemies, Jack. 
[22]Jack? 
[23]Want me to help take care of this? 
[24]You sound spooked. 
[25]Jack? 
[26]I appreciate the value of a pre- emptive strike in circumstances like these, I really do, but if you're going to go Generation Kill then do me a favour, OK, because I'm running out of bribe money. [A BEAT] Make it look like an accident. 
[27]You think I hired him? 
[28]Are you out of your fucking mind, Jack? 
[29]After everything I've done for you? The car, the cell phone (which you threw away), the safehouse, the fake passport? Someone has to pay for this shit, Jack! I have to pay for this shit. It comes out of my commission. You're my lousy profit margin. Why the fuck would I take a contract out on my own profit margin? You're not thinking straight. I was the one who told you to leave town! I told you to come to Rome! God damn it you've got a job to do! Why the Hell would 
[30]We're moving the drop. 
[31]We don't know yet. I'll call you ten am on the day with a venue. Give you enough time to make the noon delivery. 
[32]I told `em. I told `em if there was even the slightest chance security had been breached, you'd have dealt with it immediately. 
[33]Our pretty young Belgian client and her associates think someone on your long list of enemies might have put a tail on you. 
[34]Course not, Jack. But if, for the sake of argument, it was possible- I'm thinking it could be Galazzo. Or Simenov. Or Italian undercover. 
[35]The crooked kind. 
[36]The Belgians think they're planning to wait for the drop and exterminate you and Mathilde in one swoop. 
[37]I'm fucked if I know, Jack. If you want my opinion, they're just being jittery. I told `em you were the most security conscious professional I know. I told `em no one gets close to you. 
[38]I told `em if we couldn't trust you to keep a tight lid on operations the who could we trust? 
[39]You don't have to tell me that, Jack. For Christ's sake, you closed your own girlfriend's account... 
[40]Jack? [A BEAT] Jack? I'm sorry. 
[41]That was, um.... I'm just saying you can be relied on. 
[42]Jack? 
[43]Not only did you not kill him, you gave him my fucking money? 
[44]He's paranoid. That's why I'm paying you the GDP of a small country to get close to him. You could have got him in the sack. You should have got him in the car park. Now you're going to have to take him out long range! 
[45]Let's hope his workmanship is up to scratch. 
[46]Sweden turned Jack into a liability. Three stiffs: two shooters and an innocent civilian. I can't afford a mistake like that again. Europol are crooked but they aren't cheap. Jack's supposed to make me money. Not run up cleaning bills. 
[47]Never mind Larson. He didn't stand a chance, not against someone as paranoid as Jack. The Swede was only there to take Jack's heat off you. So don't fuck this up again. 
[48]Mind if I help myself? 
[49]Shit. 
[50]Is there any actual candy in this gas guzzler? 
[51]You're too old for this life, Jack. 
[52]You get sentimental then you fuck things up.
dialogues.INGRID:

[2]There are no wolves in the woods so close to the city. 
[3]Snow-hare. 
[4]A hunter? 
[5]You have a gun. 
[6]You have a gun! How do you have a gun? Why should you carry such a weapon? 
[7]Jack? 
[8]Jack talk to me! 
[9]Who is he? 
[10]He's not dressed like a hunter. Why is he alone? Hunters always go in pairs. For safety.
